# Connecting with Opal data server
## Login to server and assign study data
```{r, echo=FALSE}
#Load Opal R library
library(opal)
library(tidyverse)
library(epiDisplay)
# Create an opal object with the login information
erasmus_opal <- opal.login()
#Login to Opal server and assign the content of the RECORD table(s) to your RStudio environment
# RECORD wave 1, part 1
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RECORD_w1_1','RECORD.RECORD_w1_1', variables=list('code_barre','Qm33','Qm35','Qm34','Qm41','Par1','Par2','Par3','Par4','Qm73')) 
RECORD_w1_1 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RECORD_w1_1')
# RECORD wave 1, part 2
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RECORD_w1_2', 'RECORD.RECORD_w1_2',variables=list('bmi')) 
RECORD_w1_2 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RECORD_w1_2')
# RECORD wave 2
opal.assign.table.tibble(erasmus_opal, 'RECORD_w2', 'RECORD.RECORD_W2', variables=list('P2_Q1_15','P2_Q1_16','Qm36','Qm35','Qm42','P2_Q5_33','P2_Q5_32','P2_Q5_31','Par1','Par2','Par3','Par4','Qm72','P2_Q6_37','P2_Q6_36')) 
RECORD_w2 <- opal.execute(erasmus_opal,'RECORD_w2')
```
## Assign participant id as first column of your harmonized dataframes
```{r, echo=FALSE}
oth_RECORD_0 <- data.frame(id = RECORD_w1_1$id)
oth_RECORD_1 <- data.frame(id = RECORD_w2$id)
```

## When you are done with your work, logout of Opal server
```{r, echo=FALSE}
opal.logout(erasmus_opal) 
```

# Hypertension subdomain

### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension    
**Variable name**: dis_hbp_ever_0  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension at any point during the life of the participant.   
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding:**  
  
**Code**   | **Category Label**    
-----------| -------------  
0          |  Never had high blood pressure or hypertension  
1          |  Ever had high blood pressure or hypertension  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**:   
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
RECORD_W2_2<- RECORD_w2
names(RECORD_W2_2)[names(RECORD_W2_2)=="Qm35"]<- "Qm35_2"
names(RECORD_W2_2)[names(RECORD_W2_2)=="Par1"]<- "Par1_2"
names(RECORD_W2_2)[names(RECORD_W2_2)=="Par2"]<- "Par2_2"
names(RECORD_W2_2)[names(RECORD_W2_2)=="Par3"]<- "Par3_2"
names(RECORD_W2_2)[names(RECORD_W2_2)=="Par4"]<- "Par4_2"

MyMerge <- function(x,y){
  merge(x,y, by= c("id"),all=TRUE)
}

med_table_record <- Reduce(MyMerge, list(RECORD_w1_1,RECORD_W2_2))


med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_0 <- recode(as.factor(med_table_record$Qm33), 'N'=0, 'O'=1)

oth_RECORD_0<-merge(oth_RECORD_0,med_table_record[,c("id","dis_hbp_ever_0")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```  
### **Variable label**: Lifetime occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension    
**Variable name**: dis_hbp_ever_1  
**Variable description**:  Occurrence of high blood pressure or hypertension at any point during the life of the participant.   
**Value type**:  integer  
**Variable unit**:  N/A  
**Category coding:**  
  
**Code**   | **Category Label**    
-----------| -------------  
0          |  Never had high blood pressure or hypertension  
1          |  Ever had high blood pressure or hypertension  

**Harmonization status**:  complete  
**Harmonization comment**: Baseline only asks about high blood pressure whereas this wave asks for high blood pressure and also hypertension. Both variables were combined.    
**R script**:  
```{r, echo=TRUE}
med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_1<- ifelse(med_table_record$P2_Q1_15 == 0 & med_table_record$P2_Q1_16==1,0L,
                                       ifelse(med_table_record$P2_Q1_15 == 1 & med_table_record$P2_Q1_16==0,1L,NA))

med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_2<- recode(as.factor(med_table_record$Qm34),'N'=0L,'O'=1L)

med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_3<-ifelse(med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_1==1 & med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_2==1,1,
                                    ifelse(med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_1==0 & med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_2==0,0,NA))

med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1<- ifelse(med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_0==0 & med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_3==0,0L,
                           ifelse(med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_0==1 | med_table_record$dis_hbp_ever_1_3==1,1L,NA))

oth_RECORD_1<-merge(oth_RECORD_1,med_table_record[,c("id","dis_hbp_ever_1")],by="id",all.x=TRUE)
```
